1.description: A baby with a lightning bolt-shaped scar on his forehead. Mysteriously survived an attack by Voldemort that killed his parents.

2.description: A small, skinny boy with untidy black hair, bright green eyes, and round glasses. Lives in a cupboard under the stairs at the Dursleys. Strange things happen around him that he can't explain.

3.description: Learns on his 11th birthday that he's a wizard. Has been receiving letters from Hogwarts. The Dursleys have been hiding his magical heritage from him.

1.description: A big, beefy man with hardly any neck and a large mustache. Director at Grunnings drill-making company. Hates anything unusual or mysterious.

2.description: Treats Harry very poorly, making him live in a cupboard. Takes his family to the zoo for Dudley's birthday. Becomes furious when Harry accidentally makes magic happen.

1.description: Thin and blonde with nearly twice the usual amount of neck. Spends her time spying on the neighbors. Sister of Harry's mother Lily.

3.description: Knew about magic all along as her sister Lily was a witch. Has been hiding Harry's magical heritage out of jealousy and fear.

1.description: A spoiled baby, son of Vernon and Petunia Dursley.

2.description: An extremely spoiled and overweight boy who bullies Harry. Gets upset when he doesn't get enough birthday presents. Afraid of Harry after the zoo incident.

3.description: Terrified when Hagrid gives him a pig's tail after eating Harry's birthday cake. Runs around squealing in pain and fear.

1.description: An enormous man, almost twice as tall as normal and five times as wide. Keeper of Keys and Grounds at Hogwarts. Brings baby Harry to the Dursleys on a flying motorcycle.
1.role: Keeper of Keys and Grounds at Hogwarts

3.description: Breaks down the door to rescue Harry on his 11th birthday. Cannot do magic officially as he was expelled from Hogwarts. Extremely loyal to Dumbledore who trusts him completely.

1.description: Tall, thin, and very old with silver hair and beard long enough to tuck into his belt. Has blue eyes that twinkle behind half-moon spectacles. Headmaster of Hogwarts and considered the only wizard Voldemort fears.
A severe-looking woman who can transform into a tabby cat. Deputy Headmistress of Hogwarts. Worried about leaving Harry with the Dursleys.
Dudley's best friend. A scrawny boy with a face like a rat. Usually holds people's arms behind their backs while Dudley hits them.
An old lady who lives two streets away. Occasionally babysits Harry when the Dursleys go out. Her house smells of cabbage and she has lots of cats.
The most feared dark wizard who killed Harry's parents but mysteriously failed to kill baby Harry, leaving only a lightning bolt scar. Lost his powers and disappeared that night.

6.description: A tall, thin, freckled boy with long nose, big hands and feet, and flaming red hair. From a wizarding family. Youngest of six brothers. Friendly and loyal, loves wizard chess.

9.description: Loyal friend who stands by Harry. Shows skill at wizard chess and knowledge of the wizarding world. Has a pet rat named Scabbers.

16.description: Demonstrates exceptional skill at wizard chess, helping Harry navigate the giant chess set protecting the Philosopher's Stone. Shows courage by sacrificing himself in the game.

6.description: A bossy-looking girl with lots of bushy brown hair and rather large front teeth. Very knowledgeable about magic despite being Muggle-born. Already read Hogwarts: A History before arriving.

9.description: Brilliant student who knows more spells than anyone in first year. Can be annoying with her know-it-all attitude, but proves herself brave when helping Harry and Ron with the mountain troll.

16.description: Uses her extensive knowledge of plants and potions to help Harry get through Snape's logic puzzle protecting the Philosopher's Stone. Shows both intelligence and courage.

5.description: A pale, pointed-faced boy with sleek blond hair. Arrogant and rude. From a wealthy pure-blood wizarding family. Immediately shows prejudice against Muggle-borns and those he considers beneath him.

6.description: Sorted into Slytherin House. Becomes Harry's school rival. Constantly bullies other students and tries to get them in trouble. Has two cronies, Crabbe and Goyle.

11.description: Challenges Harry to a wizard's duel at midnight, but doesn't show up - it was a trap to get Harry in trouble. Shows his cowardly and scheming nature.

7.description: A teacher with greasy black hair, sallow skin, and a hooked nose. Head of Slytherin House and Potions master. Shows immediate dislike for Harry Potter during the Sorting ceremony.

8.description: Deliberately tries to intimidate and humiliate Harry in his first Potions class. Asks difficult questions and criticizes Harry unfairly. Shows clear bias against Gryffindor students.

11.description: Suspected of cursing Harry's broomstick during the Quidditch match. Seen muttering an incantation while staring at Harry. However, was actually trying to counter-curse the real culprit.

17.description: Revealed to have been protecting Harry all along. Created the logic puzzle protecting the Philosopher's Stone. Despite his harsh treatment, he was trying to save Harry from the real threat.

5.description: The Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher. Pale and nervous with a slight stutter. Wears a purple turban which he claims he got from an African prince as thanks for getting rid of a troublesome zombie.
5.role: Defense Against the Dark Arts Professor

8.description: Timid teacher who seems afraid of his own subject. Students find his classes boring and ineffective. Always nervous and stuttering, especially around other teachers.

11.description: Present at the Quidditch match when Harry's broomstick was cursed. Appears to be knocked over by Hermione when she set Snape's robes on fire, but was actually the one cursing Harry's broom.

17.description: Revealed as the true villain trying to steal the Philosopher's Stone for his master, Voldemort, who has been sharing his body and hiding under the turban. No longer stutters when his true nature is revealed.

6.description: A round-faced, forgetful boy who often loses things. Raised by his grandmother after his parents were tortured into insanity by Death Eaters. Sorted into Gryffindor despite seeming more timid than brave.

8.description: Struggles in most classes, especially Potions where Professor Snape constantly bullies and intimidates him. Often has accidents with spells and potions.

16.description: Shows unexpected courage by trying to stop Harry, Ron, and Hermione from leaving the common room, believing they will lose Gryffindor more House points. Hermione puts a Full Body-Bind curse on him.

recaps.1: We meet the Dursley family living a very ordinary life, while strange magical occurrences hint at something unusual brewing. That night, a baby named Harry Potter is left at their doorstep by Dumbledore and McGonagall.
recaps.2: Harry grows up living under the stairs and endures mistreatment from the Dursleys. He begins receiving mysterious letters which his uncle Vernon desperately tries to stop him reading.
recaps.3: The letters flood the house until the Dursleys flee to a remote hut. Hagrid arrives, reveals to Harry that he is a wizard, and gives him a letter inviting him to Hogwarts.
recaps.4: Hagrid takes Harry to Diagon Alley to shop for school supplies. Harry learns about his fame in the wizarding world and gets his wand from Mr. Ollivander.
recaps.5: Harry explores Diagon Alley and meets Professor Quirrell at the Leaky Cauldron. He also encounters Draco Malfoy at Madam Malkin's robe shop.
recaps.6: Harry travels to Hogwarts on the Hogwarts Express, where he meets Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger. At the castle, students are sorted into Houses by the Sorting Hat.
recaps.7: Harry begins his first week at Hogwarts, attending various classes and learning about the teachers. He discovers Professor Snape seems to dislike him immediately.
recaps.8: Harry has his first Potions lesson with Professor Snape, who embarrasses him in front of the class. Classes continue and Harry starts to settle into school life.
recaps.9: Harry saves Hermione from a mountain troll on Halloween, and the three become friends. They also learn that someone tried to break into Gringotts bank.
recaps.10: Harry discovers he has a natural talent for Quidditch and joins the Gryffindor team as Seeker, the youngest in a century.
recaps.11: During Harry's first Quidditch match, his broomstick is cursed and tries to throw him off. Hermione suspects Professor Snape but doesn't realize the real culprit is Professor Quirrell.
recaps.12: Harry receives an Invisibility Cloak for Christmas and explores the castle at night, discovering the Mirror of Erised which shows his deepest desire - his parents.
recaps.13: Dumbledore explains the Mirror of Erised to Harry and moves it. Harry, Ron, and Hermione research Nicolas Flamel and discover the Philosopher's Stone.
recaps.14: Hagrid accidentally reveals that Fluffy will sleep if music is played to it. The trio realizes someone is planning to steal the Philosopher's Stone.
recaps.15: Hagrid wins a dragon egg in a card game. The dragon, Norbert, grows quickly and becomes dangerous, leading to complications for the trio.
recaps.16: Harry, Ron, Hermione, and Neville are caught out of bounds and sentenced to detention in the Forbidden Forest. Harry encounters Voldemort drinking unicorn blood and is saved by Firenze the centaur.
recaps.17: Harry confronts Professor Quirrell, who reveals he has been trying to steal the Philosopher's Stone for his master, Voldemort. Harry prevents the theft and Voldemort's return to power.
